place_description:
Freshly Baked, Everyday

Since our launch into the United States in 2004, TOUS les JOURS [meaning "everyday" in French] has developed into a reputable neighborhood bakery specializing in French-Asian inspired baked goods, hand crafted beverages and bold, flavorful coffee and espresso made with the finest ingredients.

With a commitment to using only the finest ingredients, our products are known for their unique flavors and wholesome qualities. Our skilled bakers create a wide array of delicious treats that are freshly baked and ready to be enjoyed by our customers seeking exceptional taste and quality.

reviews_data.review_text: Amazing bakery items!
Such a cute spot! The food is to die for and the staff is really friendly! Prices are also amazing. Only downside is the parking isn't great thankfully there's a garage across the street!
It's always nice to go to Tous Les Jours, nice French-Korean Bakery, good combination. Service is the best.

Delicious fresh baked goods with a cozy atmosphere and welcoming staff.

We tried multiple sweet and savory treats and everything was fresh and yummy.

I wish they had a larger dinning area with more tables as it got crowded really quickly.

Great experience overall. Highly recommend this place.
I recommend the chocolate covered croissants and strawberry cloud cake .

My new favorite go to spots to wfh! Pastries are delicious! Atmosphere was very cute! The person that helped me a lot was Simon he answered all my questions and was really friendly! Definitely will be coming back regularly!

Beautiful Cafe & Great staff! Southend location of Tour Le Jour is smaller, but the ambiance & service is top-notch! Everybody must try, it's such a great place to work, socialize. Music is always amazing.
I'm visiting from Savannah Georgia and this place was amazing tasted delicious it was so cute and the two girls in the front were so sweet definitely will come back when we visit again.

Popped in to see if the prices were any better than back East. Sure enough, it was about $2-3 cheaper, so I couldn't resist grabbing one even though we had dinner plans. The staff was super friendly, and that bread was so good, we came back after dinner and picked up two more.

That milk cream bread is no joke - it might just be the best thing Tous les Jours has going. Seriously, it's a winner no matter where you get it!
Great choice of pastries, cakes and drinks. There are couple tables to sit down and couple parking spots. Very tiny space with cozy atmosphere.

I used to love coming here for fresh pastries but now they are wrapping each individual pastry in plastic and they are now soggy and sad instead of crisp and fresh. Why did you all do this? It defies logic to put fresh pastries into plastic...
Strawberry cloud cake and  mango could piece was good
Place is small but the food tastes good. Their cloud cake and kimchi croquette is one of my fav.

Starting to notice all of the Tous Le Jours locations are either cutting back or just removing all of the savory items off their selection of baked goods entirely. This was the only spot left in the surrounding Charlotte area that still carried the hotdog breads, and sadly, they are no longer here. Very disappointing. One of the only reasons I even visit. Not much of a sweets person, so depriving a clientele base that prefer "savory" over "sweets" seems ill-advised.

I loved this place but recently they have not been making any of the savory foods, of course their sweet treats are great but the main reason I keep coming back is for their savory breakfast/brunch items. Now that they are not serving them I will unfortunately have to find another bakery to visit - until they bring back the croquettes.
The breads and desserts were delicious! Customer service was good, and the atmosphere was pleasant. There are many delicious options to choose from.

I tried this charming French-Asian bakery and was blown away by the innovative fusion of flavors and textures. The pastries, such as the croissants, donuts with passion fruit-manggo filling and varieties of cakes with matcha and fruity flavors, were familiar, exotic  and a delightful twist to traditional French baked goods. The bakery's commitment to using high-quality, locally sourced ingredients shone through in every bite, making it a must-visit destination for anyone looking to indulge in a unique and delicious culinary experience. As a Filipino, the glutinous rice donut reminded me of home and the dessert that my grandma loves to whip when  I was young. Indeed , mus-visit  !!

Walked in at open and had a nasty encounter with employee!!! 1st. ... only 10% of their baked goods were even out with multiple people working??? A young female was super nasty, corrected me with so much attitude and horrible conduct even after I apologized and left a tip (for the other sweet girl). At the end of checking out, I nicely mention to her that there are a few gnats in the bakery case - she never looked up at me and had an irritated face the entire time. I get it ... its morning time and you gotta work but learn to treat and talk to people with love. The other girl in there is always a doll, FYI.
Good pastry options. Great service.

Went here on a whim just looked up close bakeries , and I there were so many good options I  like barely decided I ended up leaving with 5 items came out to 27 dollars and everything was so good !! Literally blown away definitely coming back to try more and get coffee next time!

This was our first time going to this bakery. It was really pretty and the atmosphere was nice and comfortable. It's mostly self serve which takes a lot if pressure off when trying a new place where there's a lot of options. However, the only negative thing wad the lady checking us out. She was very rude and didn't have good customer service skills. Didn't even greet us in and spoke to us very aggressively and bluntly when we were checking out. I normally don't make a review like this but since it was our first time there it just felt necessary. Will try a different location next time.

Stopped here for the first time after leaving Snooze in the same strip. I'm so happy we did. Lots of fresh bakery items as well as lattes, tea, coffee, and Frappuccinos. We purchased the Caramel Apple Pie danish to take home. There is limited seating. Outdoor parking. Pleasant personnel.  We will be returning.

Absolutely live this place!
-it's all fresh and made daily
- The cake is SO GOOD! It's fluffy and is topped with a whipped frosting
- Whatever they don't sell they typically donate it to local business
- In my opinion cheap prices

Tous les Jours which means "every day" in French is a South Korean bakery franchise. This place is one of the finest bakeries with fantastic ambience. Coming to pastry section, We have ordered Guava Danish, Strawberry Croissant and Chocolate croissant. Guava Danish was the winner. Green tea cloud cake and choco cloud cake were light, mouth watering and goes very well with latte. Raisin bread was fluffy, aromatic and has the right amount I of sweetness. Caramel cheesecake was little bit over sweet. Coming to coffee, Iced tiramisu latte, vanilla latte, lavender latte and cappuccino were outstanding.
Staff are not friendly. The place was dirty and seemed junky. We actually love this franchise and was disappointed by this location. I'd recommend to go to South Park and not waste your time.
Shaniyah and Mozi were amazing explaining the menu and making suggestions. Wonderful customer service we will be back, great experience for our 1st time
The selection is amazing, the treats are all tasty. A good mix of savory and sweet. All the drinks are great, the place is cute. I would come here everyday if I could.
Literally the best cakes in Charlotte, so delicious, the inside of the store is always clean and the staff are amazing! Super accommodating and always make sure I leave happy.
Delicious!

im french and this is my favorite bakery in charlotte so far

chocolate avalanche: 12/10
strawberry bread: 22/10
croque-monsieur: 10/10

and the strawberry lemonade with a touch of carbonation  made my day

excited to try a lot more things next time we visit

parking sucks tho but the pastries are worth it
I was so excited to visit this place as soon as moved here. Absolutely stunning bakery, delicious foods. will more than likely be back.

Update: went here again on a Sunday and some of the pastries honestly tasted a bit old and stale, not daily fresh but from yesterday. Bit disappointing.

Tried this cafe for the first time and it was great! The pastries were fresh and absolutely delicious! Staff was nice and everything was very clean and pristine. Highly recommend!

The place is really small. There weren't a lot of people inside but it was still a little hard to get around. I like to take my time looking at things, even more so since this was my first time here, but each time I would stop and look it felt like I was holding the people behind me up. Despite this, they offer a TON of baked goods. The staff were incredibly friendly as well. I got a honey castella, honeydew melon bread, taro loaf, honey mochi pancakes, and an iced red velvet latte. They were okay, a little stale but this may have been due to the fact that I ate them at home and not in the store. The red velvet latte was okay too, it didn't really taste like red velvet until I reached the pieces at the bottom of the cup. Overall, not bad but I just wish it was bigger and the seating wasn't so cramped. If I come here again, it will be for the honeydew melon bread
Absolutely wonderful!!!
Fresh baked pastries, bread, and desserts that are OMG amazing!!! They have the best service and even the customers can sell you on what's good. A hidden treasure in the Queen City.

Heamy fellow Charlatans or soon to be visitors. When in the Queen City, Southend  is where you wanna be if you love French pastries. Tous less Jours is a very warm, posh, and great spot to have great coffee & pastries all day. Just make sure when you go their you experience Brittany's great customer service and lovely smile, Mike's welcoming presence and of course Mozi's craving coffee creations. She's great on detail and meticulous on how she crafts your drink. Also Worker is normally somewhere helping the entire show run smoothly. Thanks guys for the great experience, I shall continue to be a patronizing customer

Finally, I made my way to visit this location for the Yelp experience. First off, this is located right off South Blvd, and let me say parking is rough! There are only a few spaces in front of the shop, and you also have to deal with that rough south end traffic. I went during my lunch break, which I took early just to beat lunchtime traffic. There was no traffic and about 2 parking spaces to choose from. The shop itself is super cute and small. Upon entering, you are greeted with a variety of pastry and bread selections. The ladies at the counter were super nice and helpful. You get a tray in the beginning and your pair of tongs and start selecting any pieces you would like. I got the spinach and feta Danish, which I read tastes better warming up in the oven, which I'm so excited. I ended up wanting to purchase chocolate filled fluffy donut, which I'm so excited to try out! I also bought a vanilla latte, which was def. Needed for this cold weather. It was not too expensive as I thought it would be, and they were actually reasonably prices $3+. I did find out they have other locations, which I def do. Intend on visiting.

Everything here was so good. I love trying new bakeries and this one did not disappoint. For a first-timer, the setup was a little confusing,  it I did like the self-serve aspect since they do get pretty  busy.

Easy to find with one of the most awkward parking lots I've seen, Tous Les Jours is an amazing bakery. You walk in the door and the smells immediately make your stomach growl in anticipation.

The two young ladies working there were lovely and polite. They became quite busy soon after I arrived but remained calm, cool and collected.

I had a caramel frappe and a spinach feta pastry while there. Both were very yummy. One of the young ladies packed my to-go bag professionally so nothing was squished by the time I got home.

Everything was so fresh, delicious, and affordable. Can't wait to go back.

Phenomenal!!! We travel all over for my husbands job. I believe I came across this place from a blog on Pinterest and had it saved on Google maps as a place I wanted to go. We were in town and went here last minute. I don't have a single sweet tooth but my husband and son do. I can't even tell you what all they got but I got a piece of strawberry cake, a pumpkin something or other and one thing that looked like a sugar doughnut but was filled with cheese. We bought about $50 of random things because we don't normally stop by places like this. Even after a few days in the fridge everything was SO good. Nothing was too sweet and the staff was beyond helpful and nice. I'd love to stop by again if we have time before we leave town. If your thinking about trying this place, just do it! I can't say enough good things about it! Good job y'all!!
Excellent service, the desserts are delicious as is the coffee. I am a coffee lover
Everything looked and tasted amazing! Had a hard time choosing. Everything was so fresh. The staff was so friendly! Vanilla latte was delicious!
Everything I've tried here has been excellent and tastes extremely fresh (macarons, croquettes, croissants) and staff has been polite every time I've come in! Can't wait to try more.

I heard their name from my friends in Boston so tried the one in Charlotte. Coffee and cakes were excellent. I wish the place was bigger. It is not a place for having your coffee and working from there.
Amazing deserts, park at chipotle in the morning

This was our second time visiting this bakery and first visit to this particular location. The selection was great, everything looked fresh & delicious, staff was friendly and informative, and we enjoyed everything we purchased. Mango cream donut is one of my favs!

This one is my favorite... always the freshest. All their employees seem so nice, the fact they put certain foods in a heater where the other locations doesn't and it's always full of product ... needless to say I'm in one or the other multiple times a week... they take a whole lot of my money but worth it

Cute cozy spot for coffee and exceptional pastries. Limited seating. All of the sweet pastries deserve a try. I ate as much as I could for the two days I was in town. Quality coffee and attentive staff.
The best food & service,good place
Great atmosphere.  Wonderful customer service.  Amazing pastries.
I like how you can pick your own items.  Very good!

I didn't appreciate the service I received from the manager. She was helping out at the cash register. She stopped being friendly when I looked for a coupon I saw on ig.

The pastries are good! They don't quite compare to how they taste in Korea, but they take care of the itch that I have for French-Korean baked goods

Las muchachas fueron muy amables con nosotros , supimos de este lugar y decidimos ir porque no se encuentra lugares asi aqui con panes y dulces que se vean y sepan deliciosos. Lo recomiendo no son costosos tampoco tan dulces estan en el punto perfecto. Nosotros pedimos para llevar.

This is my favorite bread for buttered toast.
Can't wait to try all of their pastries

The food was good, but the kimchi croquette was a little spicy and when I ask about this they told me no so I waste my money in that lol, but I recommend the garlic croassant and the mango one was delicious
Great bakery and wonderful staff! My favorite place to buy treats!

We went to the southend location just after it opened and found many bakery items over and they were not refilling them that day. They were also out of Fresh baked savory items.

But, we definitely recommend the Piedmont location. The ambience and food in that location is much better than here.

Quaint small bakery with a wide assortment of fresh baked products. Would be nice to see pricing prior to selecting items on a tray and snaking through the store. Special breads like chestnut need chestnuts spread more evenly  throughout the bread
Bakery items are phenomenal. This has to be the best bakery I've ever been to. Would highly recommend others to come
Almond croissants are the best!

This bakery in Charlotte is a croissant and bread lover's paradise! They offer an incredible variety, and the quality is outstanding. The coffee was delightful, and the service was impeccable - friendly and attentive. The ambiance of the bakery creates a cozy and welcoming atmosphere. I'll be definitely back for more!
The pasteries were AMAZING, I didn't get a special coffee but next time definitely will!! Even though it was so busy the staff was so pleasant and efficient. Overall a great experience!
Super cute spot. The pastries tasted as good as they smelled. The 4-stars is only because of limited seating and parking; it's definitely a grab-and-go spot but a delish spot to check out!

Every pastry we tried was amazingggg. First time having the honey cheese pancakes Omg so delicious. The doughnuts tasted fresh, the strawberry and creme pastry was *chefs kiss. My boyfriend also had the cookies and cream macaroons and he was annoyed  he only bought one haha! We demolished our pastries even though we wanted to save some for later they were THAT good. I also bought a cheesecake that I can't wait to have for dessert tonight :) my boyfriend had the strawberry smoothie and said it tasted fresh and not too sweet. The only thing I would say that was slightly disappointing was the butter pecan latte. It was lacking something I just can't put my finger on it. Overall we will DEFINITELY be back to try other items. Service was amazing as well. Thanks offline for having us!

Everything is so delicious! We love this location, right across from Atherton and we love ALL the sweet and savory treats. The strawberry and mango croissants are my favorite while my husband LOVES the focaccia bread and the croquettes! All the beverages are delicious, the honey lavender matcha latte is *CHEFS KISS* and the service is top notch.
Phenomenal pastries and desserts! Everything seemed super fresh. Bonus points for friendly staff!
I love this place  super sweet and everything fresh and good quality. I came almost every day for my pink bread and my Icedd butter pecan with oatmilk . Lol love it
The pastries and bread are amazing! Im not sure what I got but it's not too sweet, which I love, and the dough is SUPER soft. Def should buy from!
I was blown away at how good these macarons are! I will absolutely be back soon to try their variety of breads and pastries

Oh lucky day! They were having a BOGO event today so we had a chance to try something new. We went with our trusty strawberry croissant and tried a new treat, the sweet rice donut. The croissant was chef's kiss as always. The donut was delightful too with a mochi base.
Everything was amazing and fresh! People were super nice and friendly! I will be coming back for sure!!! Thank you i have been waiting for a place like this forever!

Delicious!!!! Their lemonade isn't too sweet which is how I prefer it ! They have different varieties of pastries which are delicious and fresh ! Definitely will be going often especially for their curry croquettes!!

Finally open after signs have been out for months. Another great addition to South End food portfolio.
Compared to the other two locations in Charlotte, this one is more of a middle size - has some tables but not for large groups. I was told that the patisserie selection would be fairly similar to each other. I went here by noon so most of the patisseries were freshly baked and there were almost the full selection - not sure what it would look like closer to evening.
My favorite - the garlic cream cheese bread - was shaped differently with the flower-cut on the top. It tasted a bit sweeter compared to the one I bought from South Park location... but all good. Cute place to stop by for something light, or bring home for next day breakfast.
